title: Falling Short Of Heaven
opening: When Catherine and the Knights of Seiros ride out to seek retribution against the Western Church for their attack on the archbishop, Ashe is eager to accompany them.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: There you are. I have a request for you.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: It has to do with that plot to assassinate Lady Rhea. The bishop leading the Western Church was somehow involved.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: And speaking of the Western Church, there was also that incident in which one of the more extreme factions tried to occupy sacred land.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Enough is enough, so now the Knights of Seiros have been tasked with putting the bishop down. I thought you and your students could come with us.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Why would you want us to help?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Why for such an important mission?

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Because you wield the Sword of the Creator. Lady Rhea is going to personally execute the bishop. I have been appointed as her guard. I want your help protecting her. So what do you say? Will you come?

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: Um, excuse me! I’d like to come along.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Ashe! You were listening in? It’s not up to you whether you can “come along.”

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: Please, this is important to me.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Your adoptive father, Lord Lonato, had connections to the Western Church. I understand that you want answers. But our objective is to punish, not to investigate. We can’t let you jeopardize the mission.

intro.speaker: Ashe
intro.line: I won’t get in the way, I promise!

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Hm... What do you say, Professor? Keep in mind we would be bringing the whole class, not just Ashe.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: OK. I guess it’s fine. Get ready, then.

intro.speaker: Catherine
intro.line: Hm. Well, can’t hurt to wait a bit, I suppose. Do let me know when you finish your preparations. This is an important mission.

battle.speaker: Bishop
battle.line: There she is -- The sneaky little witch trying to pass herself off as the goddess’s envoy... Archbishop Rhea! I’ll bring judgment upon you in the goddess’s stead!

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: They’re using the fog as cover to ambush us. What a cheap ploy.

battle.speaker: Rhea
battle.line: It won’t do any good to get annoyed, Catherine. That voice... We’re up against a faction of bishops.

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: They’ve shown themselves, at least, so we won’t have to go to the trouble of finding them. All right. You got a death wish? Come at me! You really want to fight against Thunder Catherine?

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: Please, Professor. Don’t let Lady Rhea get hurt. Our mission isn’t just to wipe out all the enemies, but also to protect Lady Rhea. Ready?

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: Hold the line! Don't let them attack Lady Rhea again.

battle.speaker: Rhea
battle.line: They have received reinforcements, and it seems the priests are calling them over.

battle.speaker: Ashe
battle.line: Then we'll just have to take them out!

battle.speaker: Rhea
battle.line: It seems that taking out the priest has stopped the reinforcements coming over here. We should be able to stop the reinforcements coming from the other side by taking care of the other priest.

battle.speaker: Rhea
battle.line: They will not be able to send any more troops now. Let us sweep up the stragglers.

battle.speaker: Catherine
battle.line: Good work, Lady Rhea! Let's round 'em up and cut 'em down.

boss.speaker: Bishop
boss.line: Apostates will suffer the punishment of the goddess!

boss.speaker: Ashe
boss.line: Lonato’s blood is on your hands…

boss.speaker: Bishop
boss.line: Were you Lord Lonato’s page or something? Indeed, he was a devout believer. All we did was provide Lord Lonato salvation from his misery!

boss.speaker: Ashe
boss.line: Salvation?! You used him and threw him away!

end.speaker: Bishop
end.line: Apostates! You sully the name of the goddess!

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: You are the apostates! The goddess is with me!

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Goddess, have mercy. Forgive them their sins, and save their souls...

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: It would have been better if we’d captured the bishop. But they didn’t make it easy for us. What now, Lady Rhea?

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: We must go to the headquarters of the Western Church. Perhaps there is still someone there who knows what has transpired.

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: Let us help too. It may not be much, but we’ll do whatever we can!

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I am sure you will be a great help. I am glad to have you by my side.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: Thanks, Professor. I really appreciated your help with the investigation. That’s it for today. Head back to Garreg Mach. The church will have to choose a new bishop, and do whatever else is necessary to rebuild the Western Church. Lady Rhea is grateful to all of you. She said she would send along a reward. You should feel very proud. Receiving a gift directly from Lady Rhea is exceedingly rare. Still. That was a real mess, huh? For them to come out and charge us so boldly...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I’m glad we made it out.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: As am I. We kept Lady Rhea safe, thanks to you.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I thought we were doomed.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: I did too. But we made it out somehow, thanks to you.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: Hey, where did Ashe go? I haven’t seen him for a while.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: No idea.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: Could he still be back there? I’m glad he’s so dedicated to his work, but...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: He couldn’t still be back there, could he?

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: That may be it. I hope he’s not getting in the way...

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: There you are, Ashe. We were just talking about...

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: Why the brooding expression? Hey, what’s that bundle of papers in your hand?

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: This was given to me. It has to do with my family.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Given to you?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Is this about Lord Lonato?

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: I haven’t finished reading it all yet. But I think it might offer some clues about something I need to know. Professor, Catherine. Thank you for letting me come with you on this mission. I’d better get ready to go.

end.speaker: Catherine
end.line: It’s a little painful to watch... I do hope that those papers, whatever they are, will help him get over his past. I suppose it’s time for us to start heading back to the monastery.
